snippet: At a time when the drugs used in executions are in short supply, an execution in Ohio has raised questions about the obligations of the state toward those it kills.
abstract: Execution of Dennis McGuire in Ohio, conducted with new, untested combination of drugs, took about 25 minutes and caused him to gasp, choke and struggle; his family plans to file a federal lawsuit saying execution violated the Eighth Amendment’s prohibition on cruel and unusual punishment; drugs routinely used for lethal injections are in short supply due to pressure from groups opposed to the death penalty.
lead_paragraph: At a time when the drugs used in executions are in short supply, an execution in Ohio has raised questions about the obligations of the state toward those it kills.

headline.main: After a Prolonged Execution in Ohio, Questions Over ‘Cruel and Unusual’
headline.print_headline: After a Prolonged Execution, Questions Over ‘Cruel and Unusual’
